ayPb7Lg7AFYqIfzk.name: Sneak Attack
ayPb7Lg7AFYqIfzk.description: The saboteur deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Hero Hunter.name: Hero Hunter
Hero Hunter.description:
Some hunters grow bored of simple beasts and monsters. For them, a battle-tested warrior is the finest prey.

Villains pursue selfish and cruel goals, trampling over anyone in their way.

ITGU0HjcVWJDtXYk.name: Prepared Trapper
ITGU0HjcVWJDtXYk.description: A hero hunter carries the materials to Craft two @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.AFX1V0Go9DqPWBlN]{Alarm Snares}, two @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TFnr9Gq7VXPJu0GQ]{Grasping Snares}, one @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.j9G3tnrKQ1N1dLzN]{Snagging Hook Snare}, and one @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.a2XaerM1KkPyLIPM]{Stunning Snare}. The hero hunter replenishes any used supplies each time they make their daily preparations.

ezv8OjHHct0qzog2.name: Nimble Dodge
ezv8OjHHct0qzog2.description:
Trigger The hero hunter is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see

Effect The hero hunter gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

bMXbZXdH5Fh7k4jX.name: Deadly Snares
bMXbZXdH5Fh7k4jX.description: The hero hunter Crafts a snare that would normally take 1 minute or less to Craft. The Stealth DC to locate the snare and DC to disable it with Thievery are equal to the hero hunter's Crafting DC if it's higher than the snare's DC.

ipvH91SSeasZXlNH.name: Felling Shot
ipvH91SSeasZXlNH.description: The hero hunter makes a ranged Strike. If it hits and deals damage to a flying target, the target falls up to 120 feet but takes no damage from the fall. The creature can't Fly, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}, levitate or otherwise leave the ground until the end of the hero hunter's next turn.

XztcVUSuRZBMTcYy.name: Hunter's Precision
XztcVUSuRZBMTcYy.description: The hero hunter knows how to hunt and kill any game. While in this stance, all the hero hunter's Strikes deal an additional 2d8 precision damage, and the range increment for their ranged weapon Strikes is 20 feet longer than normal. If the hunter gets a critical hit with a weapon Strike, the target also takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Chronicler.name: Chronicler
Chronicler.description:
Exploration means very little if no account of the details exist. Members of adventuring bands cherish chroniclers who record tales of their deeds.

The world is a wide, open place fraught with peril and adventure. Explorers use their knowledge of nature and survival skills to see every corner of the land.

ll3LaxvkACnszsxH.name: Live to Tell the Tale
ll3LaxvkACnszsxH.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The chronicler would gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition

Effect The chronicler instead falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} for [[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours} or until they regain 1 Hit Point.

OqsCqhHLnN6naAWU.name: Scroll Mastery
OqsCqhHLnN6naAWU.description: The chronicler can activate any scroll of a 2nd-rank spell or lower, regardless of its magical tradition.

Dancer.name: Dancer
Dancer.description:
Dance can be used to tell stories, share emotions, provide entertainment, and display a performer's athletic ability.

Performances come in a wide variety of forms, from musical methods like singing and instruments to physical dancing and juggling to simple orating and conversing.

kotwyraYf9vVKqEY.name: Fascinating Dance
kotwyraYf9vVKqEY.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dancer Strides up to their Speed. Once during this movement, when the dancer is adjacent to a creature, the dancer can attempt to mesmerize that creature, who attempts a @Check[will|dc:17] save. On a failure, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the dancer until the end of its next turn.

Dwarf Smith.name: Dwarf Smith
Dwarf Smith.description:
Many dwarves become smiths as their attention to detail, lifestyles that keep them close to useful materials such as iron, and a pride in their work all come together to become a brilliant skill set for working with armaments. Though dwarves are capable of smithing most any kind of item, most focus on armaments as a way of creating objects to defend their fellow dwarves.

From the dwarven perspective, most things in life are best done correctly, and that means taking one's time. Dwarves are a focused and intentional people, taking years or even decades to ply their trades, doing their best to make every detail perfect. The patience and dedication required for such tasks pays off, and many dwarves become experts in their respective field, trade, or area of focus. Many dwarves uphold traditions, and since dwarven origins trace back to underground life, many still hone skills focused on life underground.

fbLllas1hjP1nyuh.name: Blacksmithing Specialist
fbLllas1hjP1nyuh.description: For encounters involving blacksmithing, the dwarf smith is a 5th-level challenge.

iAzNhDbeiTKgQYWM.name: Temper Armament
iAzNhDbeiTKgQYWM.description:
The smith spends 1 day tempering a single suit of metallic armor, metallic shield, or metallic weapon. Tempering armor or a shield increases its Hardness by 1. Tempering a weapon grants the weapon a +1 circumstance bonus to damage rolls. Regardless of the item, the tempering remains for 3 days, after which item is temporarily immune to further tempering for 1 week as the technique would otherwise damage it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.ERBJL8rBEURa05N8]{Effect: Temper Armament}

R4CbdUx0ebnZ3Ew6.name: Crack the Shell
R4CbdUx0ebnZ3Ew6.description: The dwarf smith makes a Strike to break a creature's defenses. If the Strike hits and the creature is wearing armor with Hardness 9 or lower, the armor is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}. This Strike doesn't further damage armor that's already broken.

Tempest Incarnate.name: Tempest Incarnate
Tempest Incarnate.description:
When a sorcerer's blood calls to storm and sky, they can become a frightening force to behold. When that power matures, they become living conduits of the tempest.

A primalist is a wielder of primal energies and magic, sometimes taught by forces of primal power, including powerful elementals or fey of the First World. Primalists protect the natural world, offering strong medicine to those in need while facing suspicion from those who don't understand their ways.

A great many primalists belong to druidic circles, and even those who aren't members tend to be familiar with the most prominent ones in their homeland.

71n7sbHjS4pBTgne.name: Wind Rider
71n7sbHjS4pBTgne.description: A tempest incarnate ignores penalties and difficult terrain from strong winds. When flying, they don't need to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Fly} each round to avoid falling.

0lg7kGLlTsVwWOmm.name: Earthbound Vulnerability
0lg7kGLlTsVwWOmm.description: A tempest incarnate who is hit by or fails a saving throw against an effect that prevents them from flying (such as earthbind or Felling Strike) takes @Damage[20[mental]] damage in addition to the usual effects.

FQgyTPeSS1DpQsYQ.name: Hurricane Cloak
FQgyTPeSS1DpQsYQ.description: 10 feet. A creature that enters the area must succeed at a @Check[athletics|dc:38] check (if on the ground) or Acrobatics check to Maneuver in Flight (if flying) or end its movement. A creature that critically fails is also knocked back 5 feet and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. Creatures making ranged projectile and thrown attacks that pass through the area must succeed on a @Check[flat|dc:5] or the attack fails. Massive projectiles, such as thrown boulders, are not affected. A tempest incarnate can activate or deactivate this ability with a single action that has the concentrate trait.

atpJ2mtaJeJ9UzZC.name: Intimidating Storm
atpJ2mtaJeJ9UzZC.description: A creature that fails a saving throw against a cataclysm or wrathful storm spell cast by the tempest incarnate becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). A creature can only be frightened once by each casting of wrathful storm.

4JRDvfNjP0gOVJf5.name: Swiftness
4JRDvfNjP0gOVJf5.description: The tempest incarnate's movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Mime.name: Mime
Mime.description:
Mimes are performers who use movement, gestures, and expressions without any speech to act out a scene or situation for onlookers.

Performances come in a wide variety of forms, from musical methods like singing and instruments to physical dancing and juggling to simple orating and conversing.

zgWpWhSL5eFPDsek.name: Mimicry Specialist
zgWpWhSL5eFPDsek.description: For encounters involving mimicry or pantomime, the mime is a 6th-level challenge.

LonbjPHiKpQ0rZpu.name: Skill Mimicry
LonbjPHiKpQ0rZpu.description: The mime receives a +1 circumstance bonus to skill checks to perform actions they have witnessed another creature successfully perform in the last minute, or +2 if they witness a creature critically succeed instead.

esZ7IFO1aPcIn4T5.name: Versatile Performance
esZ7IFO1aPcIn4T5.description: The mime can use Performance instead of Diplomacy to [[/act make-an-impression statistic=performance]], instead of Intimidation to [[/act demoralize statistic=performance]], and instead of Deception to [[/act impersonate statistic=performance]].

I6oggW1yXL9bI8Iz.name: Mimic Assault
I6oggW1yXL9bI8Iz.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements A creature damaged the mime with a weapon Strike since their previous turn

Effect The mime makes a Performance check against the Perception DC of the creature who damaged them, gesturing as if making an attack with the same weapon. On a success, the mime deals two dice of damage to the creature, using the same type and die size as the required weapon Strike.

3KRBTeawv2IY2roA.name: Pantomime
3KRBTeawv2IY2roA.description:
The mime uses exaggerated movements to emulate one of the following effects, which lasts until the end of their next turn. Any creature who sees this ability can attempt to disbelieve this ability as it is used with a @Check[will|dc:14] save. Creatures that disbelieve are temporarily immune to pantomime for 1 minute.

Barrier: The mime creates an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} 10-foot-by-10-foot stretch of wall adjacent to them and within their reach. The wall has AC 10, 5 hardness, and 10 HP. If the mime Sustains this effect, they can add an additional wall in the same manner.

Rope: The mime tugs an invisible rope, trying to knock over or pull at a creature within 15 feet. If the creature fails to disbelieve the pantomime, the mime can choose to either knock the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} or to move it 5 feet towards them.

Wind: The mime creates a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of imaginary wind. Creatures who don't disbelieve the pantomime treat this area as difficult terrain, and if they enter or begin their turn in the area, they fall prone.

Bandit Gang.name: Bandit Gang
Bandit Gang.description:
Cutthroat crews of criminals form gangs to take out larger scores and intimidate their victims. Bandit gangs are often accompanied by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-npc-core.Actor.AdZ4EklEmpHViycl]{Gang Leader}.

In the underbelly of society, the lawless reign supreme.

AoJIKuZvXaMkEfMA.name: Lie in Wait
AoJIKuZvXaMkEfMA.description: The troop can spend 10 minutes preparing the ground before combat to gain a +2 circumstance bonus to their initiative roll.

Q4vdhKajjsRObWoT.name: Sudden Ambush
Q4vdhKajjsRObWoT.description: When the troop rolls initiative using Deception or Stealth, they can use Stand and Deliver! as a free action.

DfON8v909jMLsLaL.name: Chop 'em Down!
DfON8v909jMLsLaL.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The bandits make a coordinated attack with their axes against each enemy in a @Template[emanation|distance:5] with a @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+3)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+9)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d6+9)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

tksvobKNKfovQxnZ.name: Forest Passage
tksvobKNKfovQxnZ.description: The bandit gang ignores any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth.

GaNuN6hXeQKNOEPh.name: Launch Slings!
GaNuN6hXeQKNOEPh.description: The bandits draw or reload their slings, then launch a volley of sling bullets. This is a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 50 feet that deals @Damage[(2d6+4)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save. When the troop is reduced to 2 or fewer segments, this area decreases to a @Template[burst|distance:5].

jt6S0u8qw2Td8g3n.name: Stand and Deliver!
jt6S0u8qw2Td8g3n.description: The troop attempts to [[/act demoralize]] up to 4 creatures.

ShNuWVLigReArh8g.name: Troop Movement
ShNuWVLigReArh8g.description: Whenever a troop moves, you move one of its segments and the other segments follow behind it. At the end of the movement, you can group the other segments adjacent to the one you moved as you see fit, provided none of them moves farther than the moving segment. If you choose not to move the troop any distance, you can instead reshape the position of all the segments as long as one stays in place.

Burglar.name: Burglar
Burglar.description:
These criminals specialize in breaking and entering, gaining access to secure buildings and bypassing security measures undetected.

In the underbelly of society, the lawless reign supreme.

pdXfhk4J4QR9Rhw5.name: +1 Bonus on Perception to Find Traps

Y4ZPmVCbnUAexfGS.name: +1 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Traps

sDwLsrlMceRxlzIo.name: Deny Advantage
sDwLsrlMceRxlzIo.description: The burglar isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 4th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

zS04tb23VRw9X9kX.name: Nimble Dodge
zS04tb23VRw9X9kX.description:
Trigger The burglar is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see.

Effect The burglar gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

OzTxpPbEz9oZ7Oxz.name: Mobility
OzTxpPbEz9oZ7Oxz.description: When the burglar Strides half their speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.

J2jz17JAQtHVQs5I.name: Sneak Attack
J2jz17JAQtHVQs5I.description: The burglar deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Laex9xerP0tAva7M.name: Surprise Attack
Laex9xerP0tAva7M.description: On the first round of combat, if the burglar rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.

Grave Robber.name: Grave Robber
Grave Robber.description:
Many cultures have a tradition of burying their dead with a selection of the deceased's most precious possessions. Such valuables can be easy pickings for those with no respect forâ€”or fear ofâ€”the dead.

In the underbelly of society, the lawless reign supreme.

sYkKuB3z4lzIeR9O.name: Alchemical Embalming
sYkKuB3z4lzIeR9O.description:
The grave robber carries alchemical vials of specially prepared embalming fluid meant to hinder pursuit by anyone who interrupts their grave-robbing. A creature hit by a grave robber's embalming flask takes a â€“10-foot penalty to all its Speeds for 1 round. On a critical hit from an embalming flask, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HVGl2hSrfqHE4OZ2]{Effect: Alchemical Embalming}

Street Musician.name: Street Musician
Street Musician.description:
Many musicians make their living off stage by playing at markets, fairs, or crossroads. While their fame may not be as widespread as theatrical performers, they are nonetheless staples of many communities.

Performances come in a wide variety of forms, from musical methods like singing and instruments to physical dancing and juggling to simple orating and conversing.

VMKC1y1oeUVsuSsU.name: Distracting Drone
VMKC1y1oeUVsuSsU.description:
Requirements The street musician is playing their instrument

Effect The street musician attempts a @Check[type:performance|against:will] check compared to the Will DC of an observer within 30 feet. On a success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the street musician and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round.

OcLH5ZzoXOVbRkZq.name: Sneak Attack
OcLH5ZzoXOVbRkZq.description: The street musician deals an additional 1d4 precision damage to offguard creatures. This increases to 1d6 against creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} due to the street musician's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or distracting drone.

Champion of Rovagug.name: Champion of Rovagug
Champion of Rovagug.description:
There are perhaps no mortals more anathematic to peace than champions of Rovagug or other destructive deities.

Villains pursue selfish and cruel goals, trampling over anyone in their way.

JPfhAGCkOiNO4l5C.name: Champion's Aura
JPfhAGCkOiNO4l5C.description: 15 feet. Any follower of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.Bhxji0kxIbMKqdkw]{Rovagug} in the aura knows the champion is a champion of Rovagug. Enemies in the aura take a â€“1 circumstance penalty to saves against fear, and an enemy that ends its turn in the aura can't reduce the value of its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition below 1. The aura can be suppressed or resumed with a single action, which has the concentrate trait, and ends if the champion falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.

XFo44PTU8F1rJam8.name: Destructive Vengeance
XFo44PTU8F1rJam8.description:
Trigger An enemy in the champion's aura damages the champion

Effect The champion increases the amount of damage they take by @Damage[2d6] and deals @Damage[2d6[spirit]] damage to the triggering enemy. In addition, until the end of the champion's next turn, the champion's Strikes against the triggering creature deals 2 extra spirit damage.

ukrKHlplaukPtbEY.name: Axe Swipe
ukrKHlplaukPtbEY.description: The champion makes a melee Strike with a +1 circumstance bonus to the attack roll and compares the roll to the AC of up to two foes that are in reach and adjacent to each other. The champion rolls damage only once and applies it to each creature they hit. This counts as two attacks toward their multiple attack penalty.

WWpESEUIJ0EQdUuy.name: Fearsome Armament
WWpESEUIJ0EQdUuy.description: The champion grants their greataxe the fearsome rune while they wield it.

Combat Engineer.name: Combat Engineer
Combat Engineer.description:
Be it a bridge to get a battalion across a river, watchtowers to pierce the fog of war, or fortifications to secure territory, armies have always needed those who can build. The combat engineer is a soldier specializing in these sorts of constructions.

A military serves to defend and fight on behalf of nations and can be trained and deployed in various ways.

WXobLcqaScyPRT0G.name: Logistics Specialist
WXobLcqaScyPRT0G.description: In situations involving battlefield engineering or logistics, the combat engineer is a 5th-level challenge.

6BwdBhe1pPRRxFrF.name: Fortify
6BwdBhe1pPRRxFrF.description: The combat engineer digs trenches and constructs earthen barricades at a rate of one 5-foot cube per hour. A combat engineer can instead direct the work of four allied Small or larger creatures to quadruple this rate.

NczFHVe7cMLgCS3g.name: Improvised Barricade
NczFHVe7cMLgCS3g.description:
Requirements The combat engineer has at least 5 Bulk of loose items or material within reach

Effect The combat engineer slaps together a 5-foot high barrier in an adjacent square. The barrier is an object with 10 Hit Points, 5 Hardness, AC 10, and it provides standard cover. After 1 minute, the barrier collapses under its own weight.

Razzle Dazzler.name: Razzle Dazzler
Razzle Dazzler.description:
The razzle dazzler is a particularly beguiling sort of entertainer who specializes in delighting with illusions and showy displays. Whether with their illusory double or some well-timed fireworks, they are exceptionally good at keeping their audiences focused on one display to distract from the secrets that make their magic possible.

Because their ancestors came from the First World, gnomes are intrinsically linked to the realm of the fey and crave the mystical and unpredictable. They seek to create daring works of art, voyage to new places, and have experiences they've never had before. Otherwise, they could fall victim to the terrible gnomish illness known as the Bleaching, which not only drains them of their color but of their spirits as well.

16GapaocUFBhDvDr.name: Daunting Charisma
16GapaocUFBhDvDr.description:
Trigger The razzle dazzler rolls initiative using Deception or Performance

Effect The razzle dazzler can attempt to [[/act demoralize]] one creature they can see.

qJml3cgdrzvlNocV.name: Dazzling Duplicate
qJml3cgdrzvlNocV.description: The razzle dazzler creates an illusory duplicate of themself in their space that lasts for 1 round. A creature who attacks the razzle dazzler must first attempt a @Check[flat|dc:11]. On a failure, the attack misses the razzle dazzler and destroys the illusion instead, ending this effect.

Forlorn Artist.name: Forlorn Artist
Forlorn Artist.description:
Forlorn elves, who spend their lives among shorter-lived peoples, often grow morose from constant loss. Some channel this melancholy into their art.

Elves' long lives give them centuries to delve into studies, artistry, or exploration.

GA8PO1XizYt1JtCd.name: +2 Bonus on Perception to Notice Unusual Artwork

cV4Kub9vZA8CqaqH.name: Art Specialist
cV4Kub9vZA8CqaqH.description: For encounters involving crafting or evaluating art, the forlorn artist is a 4th-level challenge.

935o5SaVUaLp8sje.name: Flick Ink
935o5SaVUaLp8sje.description:
Trigger The artist is targeted with a melee or ranged Strike by a creature within 15 feet

Effect The artist flings ink in the attacker's eyes. The attacker must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:18|options:inflicts:blinded] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}. This takes effect before the attacker targets the artist. The blindness lasts until the end of the target's next turn, but the creature can Interact to rub its eyes to attempt a new save to end the condition.

wbKoBbfaKQvWmYiS.name: Cry of Ages
wbKoBbfaKQvWmYiS.description: The artist channels their loneliness into a wordless wail that forces others to contemplate their mortality. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. A creature that critically fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute. Each creature is then temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Musketeer.name: Musketeer
Musketeer.description:
Flashy and confident, the musketeer isn't above using dirty tricks to gain the upper hand in a fight. Despite their bravado, musketeers are fiercely loyal to their allies.

These lone wolves have an aura of mystery, bravado, and swagger.

FuRqBqNBG6h6r7cd.name: Musketeer's Advance
FuRqBqNBG6h6r7cd.description:
Requirements The musketeer is wielding a flintlock musket

Effect The musketeer makes a flintlock musket Strike. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to melee attacks by the musketeer until the end of the musketeer's next turn. Regardless of whether the Strike hit, the musketeer then Interacts to swap their flintlock musket for their rapier and Strides toward the creature they attacked.

lK3tALhh4hYqK6ZF.name: One for All
lK3tALhh4hYqK6ZF.description:
Requirements The musketeer is wielding a single one-handed weapon in one hand and has their other hand free

Effect The musketeer grants a +1 circumstance bonus to AC to themself until the start of their next turn. Allies also gain this bonus while adjacent to the musketeer. If a creature would benefit from more than one creature's One for All ability, the bonus is +2 instead of +1.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.CR2D12ZAhwmnbz15]{Effect: One for All}

59nUwkzA3Ahd0cDq.name: Sneak Attack
59nUwkzA3Ahd0cDq.description: The musketeer deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Harrow Reader.name: Harrow Reader
Harrow Reader.description:
A harrow deck is a set of 54 cards with symbolic illustrations that serves as a sacred divining tool. Feared by the superstitious and avoided by those who know better than to tempt fate, many harrow readers live and work in traveling communities, often moving from town to town as opportunities arise.

Hidden secrets and occult powers have an irresistible lure for many. Since the majority of these NPCs are spellcasters, consider using alternative spell lists to adjust their themes.

Gw2X2LY27hZkNR03.name: Cold Reading Specialist
Gw2X2LY27hZkNR03.description: For encounters involving fortune-telling, the harrow reader is a 3rd-level challenge.

3i4w75rSKQiwZzwD.name: Fated Doom
3i4w75rSKQiwZzwD.description: Though harrow readers try to avoid combat, no throw of the cards can avoid fate, so a harrow reader learns how best to survive. In the harrow reader's first encounter each day, they gain a +1 status bonus to their initiative roll, attack rolls, and AC.

OY73CGnCsiXU29Oz.name: Read the Harrow
OY73CGnCsiXU29Oz.description: The harrow reader can conduct a reading over the course of 10 minutes to duplicate the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} spell. The harrow reader can conduct up to five readings per day, but the flat check DC increases by 2. This is cumulative, to a maximum of DC 14 for the fifth.

Watch Officer.name: Watch Officer
Watch Officer.description:
Often leading a small team of lower-ranking guards, watch officers patrol their assigned areas to maintain order and enforce laws. Watch officers get the job done, though their methods aren't always gentle or kind.

Larger societies rely on those with the authority and the ability to interpret and enforce laws. Some carry out these duties fairly, but others are harsh and cruel, imposing severe punishments on anyone unable to pay for clemency.

2PrqruymHWvMXHjI.name: Air of Authority
2PrqruymHWvMXHjI.description: 10 feet. Creatures in the aura who are the same or lower level than the watch officer take a -2 status penalty to their Will DC against the watch officer's attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} them.

hjekwptdXb14cWSj.name: Bravery
hjekwptdXb14cWSj.description: When the watch officer rolls a success on a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, any time they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.

UhDwKtMaA99YE2vC.name: Sudden Charge
UhDwKtMaA99YE2vC.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The watch officer Strides twice. If they end their movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee Strike against that enemy.

Plague Doctor.name: Plague Doctor
Plague Doctor.description:
These healers, often seen wearing distinctive masks and burning powders to defend against airborne plagues, are as much feared as they are respected. To see a plague doctor signals that disease has infested the landâ€”and that it might have already taken hold.

The world is a dangerous place. Thankfully, there are those who devote their lives to easing the pain and suffering of others.

wsQHQNWgznslk6yH.name: +2 Circumstance Bonus on Saves vs. Disease

ZtFKTs16yHUY48WF.name: Healing Hands
ZtFKTs16yHUY48WF.description: When the plague doctor casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}, they roll d10s instead of d8s.

DzrwPVv4yZGfqMNf.name: Improved Communal Healing
DzrwPVv4yZGfqMNf.description: When the plague doctor casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} targeting a single creature, the plague doctor also restores Hit Points equal to the spell's rank to themself or any other creature within range of the spell.

Despot.name: Despot
Despot.description:
Despots live to amass and exploit power over others.

Villains pursue selfish and cruel goals, trampling over anyone in their way.

QC9XTxcZnqyYC6zU.name: Persistent Lies
QC9XTxcZnqyYC6zU.description: Any creature deceived by the despot's Deception skill believes the deception more readily on the next day. Any later Perception checks attempted against the despot's Deception DC take a â€“2 circumstance penalty, as do other creatures' attempts to convince the creature otherwise, such as through Diplomacy or further Deception.

XU2BqSl9PcE8og5Q.name: Sorcerous Potency
XU2BqSl9PcE8og5Q.description: When the despot Casts a Spell from a spell slot that deals damage, they gain a status bonus to the spell's initial damage equal to the spell's rank.

XnRBTxbwE4cyslE3.name: Tongue of Flame
XnRBTxbwE4cyslE3.description: When the despot casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Vctwx1ewa8HUOA94]{Diabolic Edict}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IihxWhRfpsBgQ5jS]{Enthrall}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ZdHjnpEQJuqOYSG]{Floating Flame}, either a target takes @Damage[1[fire]] damage per spell rank, or the despot gains a +2 status bonus to Deception checks for 1 round.

Accuser Agent.name: Accuser Agent
Accuser Agent.description:
Accuser agents might be high court advocates, official spymasters, or innocuous adjutants delivering important messages to magistrates, generals, officers, or mercenaries. They have ample latitude in matters of government security, though they sometimes have little oversight. When their findings demand an official response, accuser agents present cases before national tribunals or in royal courts.

Larger societies rely on those with the authority and the ability to interpret and enforce laws. Some carry out these duties fairly, but others are harsh and cruel, imposing severe punishments on anyone unable to pay for clemency.

t9t9UyZUzYGkBBPE.name: Insightful
t9t9UyZUzYGkBBPE.description: When the accuser agent succeeds at a Perception check, they critically succeed instead.

ZSCvVtnwBBsaHEPX.name: Objection!
ZSCvVtnwBBsaHEPX.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet takes an action with the linguistic trait

Effect The triggering creature must succeed a @Check[will|dc:28] saving throw or their action is disrupted.

pEleFpfQhh9d9z1I.name: Debilitating Sneak Attack
pEleFpfQhh9d9z1I.description: The accuser agent's Strikes deal an extra 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures. A target who takes this additional precision damage also either becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} or takes a â€“10-foot status penalty to its Speeds until the end of the agent's next turn.

Propagandist.name: Propagandist
Propagandist.description:
The misleadings, half-facts, and effortless spin propagandists cast over events create proof of whatever their bosses need them to prove.

Villains pursue selfish and cruel goals, trampling over anyone in their way.

TqHrm04cviH8w0wW.name: Nuanced Spin
TqHrm04cviH8w0wW.description: The propagandist phrases everything loosely and vaguely enough that, though it's always misleading, none of it is false. The propagandist can use Diplomacy instead of Deception to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion} or [[/act feint statistic=diplomacy]], and instead of Intimidation to [[/act coerce statistic=diplomacy]]. A creature attempting to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} against the propagandist gets a result one degree of success worse than they rolled.

P789gN78vbI3JWRR.name: No Hard Feelings
P789gN78vbI3JWRR.description:
The propagandist offers amnesty and other benefits to all who choose to join them. All enemies who can hear the propagandist must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19] save. If any of the propagandist's allies is currently benefiting from one of the propagandist's bard composition spells, any enemy who is aware of that takes a â€“2 circumstance penalty to the save.

Critical Success The creature sees through the propagandist's pitch and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature's conviction stumbles. Until the end of its next turn, the creature must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] to target the propagandist with a hostile action.

Critical Failure The creature finds the propagandist's offer too good to pass up, switching sides in the combat and instantly gaining any benefits the propagandist is currently granting their allies. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can attempt another @Check[will|dc:19] save to snap out of it and rejoin their allies.

Rancorous Priesthood.name: Rancorous Priesthood
Rancorous Priesthood.description:
Followers of Rovagug must usually conceal their devotion to the Rough Beast, hiding in remote cave complexes or abandoned ruins, but they emerge when they sense weakness, gathering together into a destructive, homicidal mob to hunt down priests of rival deities or slaughter entire towns.

Religions inspire devout individuals to uphold their tenets.

wWvqRgRb0u1JwCr6.name: Troop Movement
wWvqRgRb0u1JwCr6.description: Whenever a troop moves, you move one of its segments and the other segments follow behind it. At the end of the movement, you can group the other segments adjacent to the one you moved as you see fit, provided none of them moves farther than the moving segment. If you choose not to move the troop any distance, you can instead reshape the position of all the segments as long as one stays in place.

7cb3300PlOTebHcM.name: Troop Spellcasting
7cb3300PlOTebHcM.description: When the rancorous priesthood Casts a Spell, their constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

ty02a1CedQJfgYkL.name: Wild Swing
ty02a1CedQJfgYkL.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The members of the mob wildly swing their weapons in a chaotic attack at each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d12+2)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d12+9)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d12+9)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

Penitent of Calistria.name: Penitent of Calistria
Penitent of Calistria.description:
Atonement is seen as an ultimate act of supplication for those who have wronged their faith. Repentance takes several formsâ€”acts of service, a pilgrimage, flagellation, or divine quests.

Religions inspire devout individuals to uphold their tenets.

jbuLsvWF1rCKUZ9s.name: Agonizing Drive
jbuLsvWF1rCKUZ9s.description: The penitent ignores the penalty to attack rolls from being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} and gains a status bonus to damage rolls equal to their frightened value.

mcaFQLCGYQ4uikPg.name: Repentant Defiance
mcaFQLCGYQ4uikPg.description: The penitent Strikes, then increases their own @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} value by 2 and deals @Damage[3[slashing]] damage to themselves, bypassing resistance. The penitent then gains resistance 3 to physical damage until the start of their next turn.

Captain Of The Guard.name: Captain Of The Guard
Captain Of The Guard.description:
The captain of the guard leads a troop of soldiers who serve as security forces for a powerful individual, most often a high-ranking noble or very rich merchant, though this stat block could also represent a lowerranking captain of the guard for the leader of a nation. A formidable opponent in their own right, the captain of the guard skillfully employs their troops to protect the life and health of their ward.

Larger societies rely on those with the authority and the ability to interpret and enforce laws. Some carry out these duties fairly, but others are harsh and cruel, imposing severe punishments on anyone unable to pay for clemency.

T7oZcH7OKDm1O4cw.name: Aura of Command
T7oZcH7OKDm1O4cw.description:
30 feet. The captain of the guard bolsters lower-level guards under their command, granting them a +1 status bonus to their attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to their Will saves.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.T9wQ1LvsvPWTefQR]{Effect: Under Command}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.OxOMYmlPtjsEkRtY]{Effect: Aura of Command}

HXCEPfKkb2TP6NVy.name: Bravery
HXCEPfKkb2TP6NVy.description: When the captain of the guard rolls a success on a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, any time they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.

9hxxkHZZGdkhbZvg.name: Shield Warden
9hxxkHZZGdkhbZvg.description: When the captain has their shield raised, they can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.m4HQ2o5aPxjXf2kY]{Shield Block} when an attack is made against an adjacent ally. If they do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of the captain.

drNAUPLqWo7QSh3l.name: Shielded Advance
drNAUPLqWo7QSh3l.description:
Requirements The captain of the guard has their shield raised

Effect The captain of the guard presses forward, using their shield to push back foes. The captain Strides and Shoves, in either order. The multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, though the Shove does count toward the captain's multiple attack penalty.

Harbormaster.name: Harbormaster
Harbormaster.description:
A port must sustain itself on different types of flows: the seaward and coastal flows, marked by the rising and falling of the tides, and the constant flow of trade. A harbormaster is expected to know the former reflexively and encourage the latter within the jurisdictional rules of law.

Larger societies rely on those with the authority and the ability to interpret and enforce laws. Some carry out these duties fairly, but others are harsh and cruel, imposing severe punishments on anyone unable to pay for clemency.

vgPpoUOgBxWLd4Ne.name: Steady Balance
vgPpoUOgBxWLd4Ne.description: Whenever the harbormaster rolls a success on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance}, they get a critical success instead. They're not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while Balancing on narrow surfaces and uneven ground.

NKmPaEo138UaRnmO.name: Experienced Hand
NKmPaEo138UaRnmO.description: The harbormaster has endured their share of adverse conditions at sea. Any creature that's in adverse weather or aboard a vessel on rough water is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the harbormaster.

Root Leshy Groundskeeper.name: Root Leshy Groundskeeper
Root Leshy Groundskeeper.description:
Hardy root leshies have the strength and stamina to dig furrows for planting seeds over long hours. Though they're humble even among leshies, they can be extremely stubborn even against powerful adversaries.

Nature spirits inhabit bodies made of plants or fungi, blooming from primal magic to become the small people called leshies. They come in a truly immense number of diverse shapes and sizes, more so than most peoples of Golarion. This variety of forms means a leshy could have a place in nearly any type of setting for any type of story.

UaWa5q5xxtsbTNcZ.name: Verdant Burst
UaWa5q5xxtsbTNcZ.description: When the root leshy groundskeeper dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from their body, restoring @Damage[1d4[healing,vitality]|shortLabel] Hit Points to each plant creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. This area immediately fills with roots and vines, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain is not a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours.

CB6rpe5geo854f0K.name: Change Shape
CB6rpe5geo854f0K.description:
The root leshy groundskeeper transforms into a Small root vegetable. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

SvRzg0tGLBfvJyPC.name: Root in Place
SvRzg0tGLBfvJyPC.description: The root leshy groundskeeper roots themself into the ground, reducing their Speed to 0 and granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and 2 temporary Hit Points until the start of their next turn.

Judge.name: Judge
Judge.description:
Properly exercised, the duties of a judge include strict adherence to the law regardless of station, with minimal sentimentality. Yet for every unbiased justice, there's one who is zealously confident in their own agenda.

Larger societies rely on those with the authority and the ability to interpret and enforce laws. Some carry out these duties fairly, but others are harsh and cruel, imposing severe punishments on anyone unable to pay for clemency.

8sKYzAJzGo9HTaC9.name: Group Impression
8sKYzAJzGo9HTaC9.description: When the judge @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, they can compare their Diplomacy check result to the Will DCs of up to four targets instead of one.

HbPG05leJ9JyznH4.name: Legal Specialist
HbPG05leJ9JyznH4.description: In a legal proceeding, the judge is a 6th-level challenge.

beeNB83HJgG5Fjky.name: Remember, You're Under Oath
beeNB83HJgG5Fjky.description: The judge reminds a creature of the oath they swore to the court. The judge makes an Intimidation check against the target's Will DC. On a success, the target takes a â€“2 status penalty to Deception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie} for 10 minutes (or a â€“4 status penalty on a critical success). Regardless of the result, the target is temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

Kholo Outrider.name: Kholo Outrider
Kholo Outrider.description:
Many kholo packs are semi-nomadic, staying in one place until they're pushed out by others, or the local resources begin to grow sparse. Before moving the pack elsewhere, the leaders send out a single kholo to blaze a trail and ensure a safe route to their next destination. These outriders are masters of the wilderness and fight better when they're alone.

These pragmatic hunters have earned a very poor reputation for their brutality in battle and worship of demons. While many kholos live up to the terrible stories of their ferocity and cannibalism, others are scavengers and trappers just trying to get by. Many of their cultural traditions are misunderstood by other ancestries, and some kholos play into the fear provoked in those who believe the twisted tales about their people. Kholos are often criticized for their lack of honor in battle, but a kholo understands honor doesn't bring you back home alive, nor does honor put food on the table. Ambushes, feints, and deceptions that lead to fewer kholo deaths and a quicker victory are simply the logical thing to do.

WWAmdEhQYQENBx4H.name: Bloody Flurry
WWAmdEhQYQENBx4H.description: The kholo outrider Strikes, Steps, then Strikes again. If the kholo outrider hits the same enemy with both Strikes, that enemy takes an additional @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

dzKLA5iY2hWRfc7y.name: Rugged Travel
dzKLA5iY2hWRfc7y.description: A kholo ignores the first square of difficult terrain they move into each time they Step or Stride.

1oJPt7dlboFG0TjE.name: Solo Hunter
1oJPt7dlboFG0TjE.description: A kholo outrider deals 1d6 extra damage while adjacent to at least 2 enemies and no allies.

Spirit Priest.name: Spirit Priest
Spirit Priest.description:
While dwarves worship gods like most any other ancestry, many dwarves also look to the spirits of the world for guidance and support. Most every object and environment in the world, from a simple rock to an expansive river to the largest of mountains, contains some kind of spirit. Dwarven spirit priests learn how to communicate with these spirits. This spiritual attunement allows these priests to use magic, as well as call on these spirits in times of need.

From the dwarven perspective, most things in life are best done correctly, and that means taking one's time. Dwarves are a focused and intentional people, taking years or even decades to ply their trades, doing their best to make every detail perfect. The patience and dedication required for such tasks pays off, and many dwarves become experts in their respective field, trade, or area of focus. Many dwarves uphold traditions, and since dwarven origins trace back to underground life, many still hone skills focused on life underground.

hRgSJclrdYkLuHrx.name: Spirit's Interference
hRgSJclrdYkLuHrx.description: The spirit priest calls out to a local spirit to assault the priest's enemies. The spirit unleashes a blast of rocks, attacks with a set of vines, or uses some other appropriate part of the environment to attack all creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet of the priest. The attack deals @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save. The spirit priest can't use Spirit's Interference for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. The GM might have this ability deal a different damage type based on the local spirits, such as fire damage when calling on a fire spirit.

KZRrUi16iTJeV3Cz.name: Spiritual Edge
KZRrUi16iTJeV3Cz.description: The spirit priest aligns their spirit with their magical effects, enhancing the power of their spells. If their next action is to Cast a Spell that deals damage and doesn't have a duration, the spell deals additional spirit damage equal to the spell's rank.

Mage for Hire.name: Mage for Hire
Mage for Hire.description:
Some mercenaries sell magical talents to earn a living. While there are many types of mages for hire, some of the sneakiest are specialized in scrying, using their skills for infiltration and sabotage.

Whether they're hired to wage war, protect a caravan, or infiltrate an impenetrable fortress, there's ample work for mercenaries all over Golarion.

Beast Eidolon.name: Beast Eidolon
Beast Eidolon.description: This creature is intended to be used as the eidolon accompanying a Sarkorian god caller, but it can be used or adapted into any aggressive beast eidolon for a summoner.

3gUfUhxIO8QBuRVh.name: Furious Charge
3gUfUhxIO8QBuRVh.description: The eidolon Strides twice and then makes a Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll.

H2HkvSvxAPG03G9a.name: Primal Roar
H2HkvSvxAPG03G9a.description: The eidolon attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} each enemy within 30 feet; these Demoralize attempts don't take any penalty for not sharing a language.

2RXB3a94mH1mRWqg.name: Scent of Blood
2RXB3a94mH1mRWqg.description:
Requirements A creature within the eidolon's scent range is taking bleed damage

Effect The eidolon flies into a frenzy, gaining 10 temporary HP for 1 minute and a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its unarmed attacks, but becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. It can't voluntarily end the frenzy or start another frenzy while in the frenzy. The frenzy lasts for 1 minute, after which the eidolon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for 1 minute.

Torchbearer.name: Torchbearer
Torchbearer.description:
Torchbearers carry light sources for seasoned explorers.

Explorers are often well-equipped and well-trained for any type of hazard and are eager to lead others into the wild.

Pa0KJtbEU8gMH1Qh.name: Torch Combatant
Pa0KJtbEU8gMH1Qh.description: A torchbearer is adept at attacking with torches and deals 1 persistent fire damage when they critically hit with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.8Jdw4yAzWYylGePS]{Torch}.

Dwarf Battalion.name: Dwarf Battalion
Dwarf Battalion.description:
Dwarven soldiers make formidable units, capable of holding their own against most enemies. In combat, a dwarf battalion is a well-oiled machine, unleashing coordinated attacks against foes.

From the dwarven perspective, most things in life are best done correctly, and that means taking one's time. Dwarves are a focused and intentional people, taking years or even decades to ply their trades, doing their best to make every detail perfect. The patience and dedication required for such tasks pays off, and many dwarves become experts in their respective field, trade, or area of focus. Many dwarves uphold traditions, and since dwarven origins trace back to underground life, many still hone skills focused on life underground.

T6b3Bxelknz5jLLD.name: Dwarven Doughtiness
T6b3Bxelknz5jLLD.description: Dwarves are often calm and collected in the face of imminent danger. At the end of the battalion's turn, reduce its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition by 2 instead of 1.

kzbXoimojz0hgVKs.name: Troop Movement
kzbXoimojz0hgVKs.description: Whenever a troop moves, you move one of its segments and the other segments follow behind it. At the end of the movement, you can group the other segments adjacent to the one you moved as you see fit, provided none of them moves farther than the moving segment. If you choose not to move the troop any distance, you can instead reshape the position of all the segments as long as one stays in place.

HK3El8JaNgkSuAIQ.name: Bombing Barrage
HK3El8JaNgkSuAIQ.description: he dwarf battalion draws alchemical bombs, then hurls them at distant foes. This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet that deals @Damage[3d6[@item.flags.pf2e.rulesSelections.bombingBarrage]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage is either acid, fire, or electricity damage, depending on which type of bombs the battalion used. When the dwarf battalion is reduced to 2 or fewer segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

ajOvxZZwNfyldDXc.name: Coordinated Pummel
ajOvxZZwNfyldDXc.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The dwarf battalion unleashes a storm of warhammer blows against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+5)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+5)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

9eLEaLdSVPXS10q4.name: Dwarven War Song
9eLEaLdSVPXS10q4.description: The battalion joins together to sing a traditional song of battle. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:23|options:inflicts:frightened] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). Each enemy is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

z17MMNf9Z1J6nJKp.name: Shields Up!
z17MMNf9Z1J6nJKp.description: The battalion raises their steel shields. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and Reflex saves until the start of its next turn.

Court Jester.name: Court Jester
Court Jester.description:
Though court jesters are often put-upon as the targets of easy mockery and idle amusements, do not mistake their self-deprecation for weakness. Beneath, the jester hides malice, a sharp tongue, and even sharper knives. They can often be found entertaining the nobles of court or preparing their next japes. During the indiscreet hours of the night, they may be found in the company of servants and spymasters.

Performances come in a wide variety of forms, from musical methods like singing and instruments to physical dancing and juggling to simple orating and conversing.

CGBQVNxptG5LnjTe.name: Pointed Joke
CGBQVNxptG5LnjTe.description: The court jester can use Performance instead of Intimidation to [[/act demoralize statistic=performance]].

2EbagWaQehCMBKx5.name: No Peeking!
2EbagWaQehCMBKx5.description:
The jester blows chalk or face powder in an adjacent enemy's face. The target must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] saving throw.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure target is dazzled and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

rUD7kZKPtLrnivTt.name: Poisoned Blade
rUD7kZKPtLrnivTt.description: The jester coats their dagger in poison. These daggers inflict an additional @Damage[4d4[persistent,poison]] damage. The poison expires 1 hour after leaving the jester's possession.

Drunkard.name: Drunkard
Drunkard.description:
Every tavern has one-that person who drinks a little too much and starts a fight. While many drunkards are relatively harmless, a few have a hair trigger, and when they're set off come, no one-even the drunkard themself-can tell you what started the row.

Countless adventures begin in a tavern or a pub. Maybe it's because such places attract the risk-prone, or maybe it's because everyone needs a little liquid courage before they decide to take on a group of rampaging ogres.

UzdMoqfj4XsqRriz.name: Drunken Flailing
UzdMoqfj4XsqRriz.description:
Requirements The drunkard is raging

Effect The drunkard attempts two fist Strikes, each against a different creature.

gHkZ5EkRCbXagaxl.name: Drunken Rage
gHkZ5EkRCbXagaxl.description:
Requirements The drunkard is drunk, and isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or raging

Effect The drunkard flies into a drunken rage. They gain 6 temporary Hit Points that last until the drunken rage ends. While raging, they deal 4 additional damage with melee attacks and take a â€“1 penalty to AC. The drunkard can't use concentrate actions except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}. The rage lasts for 1 minute, until the drunkard falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or until the drunkard sobers up. The drunkard can't voluntarily stop raging. Once the rage ends, the drunkard can't gain temporary HP from this action for 1 minute.

Siegebreaker.name: Siegebreaker
Siegebreaker.description:
When a well-constructed or magically warded fortification repels every assault, a siegebreaker is called in. These masters of alchemical destruction find that the bigger and more protected the wall, the more satisfying it is to break it.

Whether they're hired to wage war, protect a caravan, or infiltrate an impenetrable fortress, there's ample work for mercenaries all over Golarion.

rRrhMpXglshRWUxw.name: Alchemical Grenades
rRrhMpXglshRWUxw.description: A siegebreaker carries 15 alchemical grenades that deal either acid, cold, or fire damage plus 10 persistent damage and 10 splash damage of the same type (typically five of each damage type). They replenish these grenades each day.

SI9QhHDLxpLn2b3x.name: Explosive Compounds
SI9QhHDLxpLn2b3x.description: When an attacker scores a critical hit against the siegebreaker, one of the siegebreaker's alchemical grenades bursts. The GM determines the grenade randomly. The siegebreaker takes damage from the grenade as though they were hit by the grenade (applying their resistance normally), and any creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] takes the splash damage.

VIv5BO5e8vFaoawz.name: Expanded Splash
VIv5BO5e8vFaoawz.description: The siegebreaker's grenades deal splash damage in a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot radius}.

FN3IMvwwDXsLxBSe.name: Quick Grenadier
FN3IMvwwDXsLxBSe.description: The siegebreaker Interacts to draw a grenade, then Strikes with it.

Bi5rajlTE3v50VDg.name: The Wall Must Fall
Bi5rajlTE3v50VDg.description:
Requirements The siegebreaker is at the base of a fortified wall

Effect The siegebreaker has studied for years to gain exact knowledge of how to combine the alchemical ingredients in their grenades to exponentially multiply their power, creating a terrifying siege-ender bomb that can break open a city wall. The siegebreaker spends 10 minutes combining the ingredients from 9 different alchemical grenades of their choice. The siegebreaker then sets a fuse timer up to 1 minute long. When time's up, the bomb explodes in a concentrated @Template[type:burst|distance:20], dealing @Damage[20d6[acid]|options:area-damage], @Damage[20d6[cold]|options:area-damage]{cold}, or @Damage[20d6[fire]|options:area-damage]{fire} damage that ignores up to 10 Hardness of structures. Any creature in the area can reduce the damage they take with a @Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect] save.

Veteran War Horse.name: Veteran War Horse
Veteran War Horse.description: A veteran war horse has not only been extensively trained but has also experienced battle several times. They have grown used to the chaos of war and fearlessly strides forward, striking fear into their enemies. A veteran war horse could accompany a champion, champion of Rovagug, captain of the guard, deific champion, equestrian constable, or orc gamekeeper.

ySUdQ32Yd0LBp7c5.name: Gallop
ySUdQ32Yd0LBp7c5.description: The veteran war horse Strides twice. It has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these Strides.

vjhC9fHFdm7SJzRk.name: Into the Fray
vjhC9fHFdm7SJzRk.description: The veteran war horse Strides then [[/act demoralize]]{Demoralizes} an adjacent Medium or smaller creature. When it does, Demoralize loses the auditory trait and gains the visual trait, and it doesn't take a penalty for the veteran war horse not speaking a language.

Big Boss Goblin.name: Big Boss Goblin
Big Boss Goblin.description:
Big boss goblins order members of their band around and deal with any longshanks they come acrossâ€”sometimes via violence or diplomacy, and sometimes by ordering another goblin to deal with them (in ways that the big boss goblin approves of if they work or claims were awful ideas they never would have tried if they don't). These goblin leaders often insist on impressive titles or sobriquets like "The Exceedingly Incendiary," "Snake Singer," or "Most Gluttonest," though these can often be exaggerated by several degrees for dramatic effect or even change at the big boss goblin's whim (often to one-up a rival).

Goblins can be found across Golarion, sometimes threatening taller humanoids (whom they refer to as "longshanks") and sometimes redeeming harmful history by working alongside others.

TgAafWHSGZBCMhwb.name: Not Me!
TgAafWHSGZBCMhwb.description:
Trigger The big boss goblin is targeted with an attack, and a goblin is adjacent to them

Effect The big boss goblin yanks the goblin in front of the attack to face the consequences in their stead. The big boss goblin gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack. If it hits, the big boss goblin takes half damage, and the other goblin takes the remaining half.

NUWCrk36qJzeNAuW.name: No Fight Fair
NUWCrk36qJzeNAuW.description:
A big boss goblin fights dirty, slashing at a foe's hamstrings. Whenever the big boss goblin hits an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} foe, the creature takes a â€“5-foot status penalty to its speed (â€“10-foot on a critical hit) until the creature regains any amount of Hit Points. As with all penalties to Speed, this can't reduce a creature's Speed below 5 feet.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.mfJIVTQ8drSzsrQc]{Effect: No Fight Fair}

UXTu6H3vuKZK9TRt.name: Stab it! Stab it! Stab it!
UXTu6H3vuKZK9TRt.description:
The big boss goblin picks a target they can see within 30 feet and orders any allied goblins to attack. A single goblin with a lower level than the big boss goblin that is adjacent to the target can immediately use their reaction to Strike the target. In addition, until the start of the big boss goblin's next turn, their attacks against that target deal 1 additional damage dice as the big boss goblin leads them.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Sv99eNoXedd9Zw26]{Effect: Stab it! Stab it! Stab it!}

Messenger.name: Messenger
Messenger.description:
When a message, mail, or package needs to be delivered, messengers make deliveriesâ€”typically from large towns and cities or to other towns and cities.

Society is built upon the backs of laborers.

WtsSGtnPgnNQ9zPz.name: Don't Shoot the Messenger
WtsSGtnPgnNQ9zPz.description: Messengers get a +2 circumstance bonus to @Check[diplomacy|options:dont-shoot-the-messenger] checks to convince another creature not to blame them for any news they deliver.

5aPn6LRI90ZQew8G.name: Express Messenger
5aPn6LRI90ZQew8G.description: Allies traveling with the messenger gain a +5-foot circumstance bonus to travel Speed, to a maximum of the messenger's travel Speed. If they use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JuqmIAnkL9hVGai8]{Hustle} activity, they can Hustle for a minimum of 1 hour instead of the usual amount.

No7D9FTwDJVHqhho.name: Road Runner
No7D9FTwDJVHqhho.description: Messengers can use Society in place of Survival to [[/act sense-direction skill=society]] when they're on a road.

axUYB41Gy8pqpyOC.name: Special Delivery
axUYB41Gy8pqpyOC.description: The messenger Interacts to take an item of light Bulk or less held by a willing ally within reach, Strides, then delivers the item to a willing ally in reach at their new location.

Pilgrim of Irori.name: Pilgrim of Irori
Pilgrim of Irori.description:
Pilgrims traverse the lands spurred on by some holy reason, be it to visit a sacred place or follow a prophetic vision.

Religions inspire devout individuals to uphold their tenets.

DgCsAlvUfVyETg6K.name: Ambulatory Oration
DgCsAlvUfVyETg6K.description: Creatures that engage in conversation with the pilgrim gain a +1 circumstance bonus to all @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} checks and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.plBGdZhqq5JBl1D8]{Gather Information} checks for 4 hours related to any topics discussed with the pilgrim.

c9RyMIISUEbGlI0s.name: Path of the Faithful
c9RyMIISUEbGlI0s.description: The pilgrim can use their Religion modifier instead of their Diplomacy modifier to [[/act gather-information skill=religion]] or [[/act make-an-impression skill=religion]] as long as the pilgrim includes their religious teachings.

Juggler.name: Juggler
Juggler.description:
Jugglers are physical performers who master the art of manipulating props. Usually, this involves throwing multiple objects up in a flowing pattern, but some use ricocheting items, spinning items, or other objects to keep them aloft.

Performances come in a wide variety of forms, from musical methods like singing and instruments to physical dancing and juggling to simple orating and conversing.

f4Y8iYvF0bqwVdWN.name: Juggling Specialist
f4Y8iYvF0bqwVdWN.description: For encounters involving juggling and other circus acts, the juggler is a 5th-level challenge.

cCwejLZc4B8akh8l.name: Return Throw
cCwejLZc4B8akh8l.description:
Trigger A physical ranged attack with a throwing weapon critically fails to hit the juggler

Effect The juggler snatches the weapon from the air and immediately makes a ranged Strike against the attacker using that weapon.

6DCBFxqTA6NPJRzi.name: Juggle
6DCBFxqTA6NPJRzi.description:
The juggler begins juggling up to three items of light or negligible Bulk. They can choose items in their hands or Interact to draw items on their person or pick up unattended items in reach. While juggling, they can Interact to add up to two items to their juggle, though they must drop an item for each one they add. The juggler is wielding all items they juggle, but the only actions they can take that require their hands are Return Throw, Juggling Bounce, Strike using a juggled weapon, Interact to add items to their juggle, or Dismiss to stop juggling.

When the juggler Dismisses Juggle, they can choose to continue to wield, drop, or stow each juggled item, though they can't wield more items than they have hands. If at any point the juggler isn't wielding any items or becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, the juggle ends and the juggler drops all the items.

a6NYStpQRrBO2h1H.name: Juggling Bounce
a6NYStpQRrBO2h1H.description: The juggler Strikes with a thrown weapon they're juggling. If the Strike hits, the weapon bounces to a different creature in the weapon's first range increment. The juggler repeats the Strike, which uses the same multiple attack penalty and doesn't increase their multiple attack penalty.

Reckless Scientist.name: Reckless Scientist
Reckless Scientist.description:
It's the reckless scientist's job to break the rules of reality, no matter the cost.

Villains pursue selfish and cruel goals, trampling over anyone in their way.

E00krW5owLvGqBHn.name: Unstable Collection
E00krW5owLvGqBHn.description: A reckless scientist carries a collection of poorly stowed alchemical items: 3 elixirs of life and 6 alchemical grenades. The scientist replenishes these items each day using scavenged materials. The alchemical grenades deal either acid, cold, or fire damage plus 2 persistent damage and 2 splash damage of the same type (typically the collection contains two of each grenade).

x8s1JWo1Jcm4elFK.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Poison

LMckIZmrAQt7HWW3.name: Unstable Explosion
LMckIZmrAQt7HWW3.description: When an attacker scores a critical hit against the reckless scientist, one of the scientist's alchemical items bursts. The GM determines the item randomly. If it was a bomb, the alchemist takes damage from the bomb, and any creature adjacent to the alchemist takes the splash damage. Any other item is wasted.

d9TOZvyquMo6o18K.name: Quick Grenadier
d9TOZvyquMo6o18K.description: The reckless scientist Interacts to draw an alchemical grenade with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

ziPz3z2a6Db63N9r.name: Reckless Alchemy
ziPz3z2a6Db63N9r.description:
The reckless scientist attempts to combine two alchemical grenades or two elixirs of life into one item. They can Interact to draw the items if necessary. They attempt a @Check[crafting|dc:22] check, destroying both component items to create one new item.

Success The new item has the full effect of both component items, and the reckless scientist can Activate it. If they don't Activate it before the end of their turn, the item explodes (as critical failure).

Failure The new item is inert.

Critical Failure The unstable item explodes, dealing @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage to the reckless scientist.
